result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison A Kircher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Follow through with any treatment recommended by Agent.
No contact with co-actors or the witnesses.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
Attend Criminal Thinking course.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Allison A Kircher in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 3 and counts 4 and 5 are dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentences:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 MONTHS JAIL (CREDIT - 0 days); Sentence is consecutive

TERM OF PROBATION:  12 months;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  co-actors or the witnesses
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Attend Criminal Thinking course
 
COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 45 days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

Defendant Allison A Kircher in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for plea and sentencing. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with co defendant, victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Allison A Kircher in court, in custody by video from Taycheedah Correctional Institution, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to be released on extended supervision on December 15, 2015.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Informing defendant that proper paperwork including indigency evaluation must be completed before an attorney can be appointed.
